poem:
"Ode to a Pirate King Vanished in Time"

Through the morning's foggy newsprint page,
I trace the ghost of Henry, rogue of the age.
He danced with Neptune, silver, gold and gem,
Evaporating like mist, escaping them.
His story drips, an unfinished swirl,
A fable spun for each gullible earl,
Lost on the crest of yesteryear's wave,
A pirate king, forever brave.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Explorers unlock the mystery of ‘pirate king’ Henry Avery who vanished after huge heist at sea In 1695, Henry Avery led his 160-strong crew to pull off the most lucrative heist in pirate history on the high seas, amassing gold, silver, sapphires, emeralds and diamonds worth more than £85m in today’s money. He became the most wanted criminal of his day but vanished without trace and was the stuff of legend for 300 years. Now". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
